abstract: The Dow closed more than 330 points higher today after unusually candid remarks by a top Federal Reserve official, who appeared to open the door to further interest rate cuts.
snippet: The Dow closed more than 330 points higher today after unusually candid remarks by a top Federal Reserve official, who appeared to open the door to further interest rate cuts.
lead_paragraph: Stocks soared on Wall Street today after a top Federal Reserve official appeared to open the door for additional interest rate cuts, pledging to follow “flexible and pragmatic policy making” as the central bank decides how to cope with the current financial upheaval.

headline.main: Fed Official’s Remarks Send Stocks Soaring

abstract: Stock markets snapped back yesterday as promising news on credit and oil emerged from the Middle East, offering investors some reassurance about two recent trouble spots.
snippet: Stock markets snapped back yesterday as promising news on credit and oil emerged from the Middle East, offering investors some reassurance about two recent trouble spots.
lead_paragraph: Stock markets snapped back yesterday as promising news on credit and oil emerged from the Middle East, offering investors some reassurance about two recent trouble spots.

headline.main: Indexes Up Sharply on Some Good News
headline.print_headline: Indexes Up Sharply on Some Good News

abstract: Promising news from the Middle East sent the Dow up 215 points, a long way toward making up for yesterday’s steep sell-off.
snippet: Promising news from the Middle East sent the Dow up 215 points, a long way toward making up for yesterday’s steep sell-off.
lead_paragraph: Stock markets snapped back today after promising news emerged from the Middle East.

headline.main: Stocks Rebound on Citigroup Deal and Oil News

abstract: Dow Jones, publisher of The Wall Street Journal, said Tuesday that it was considering the sale of the rest of the Ottaway community newspaper group.
lead_paragraph: Dow Jones, publisher of The Wall Street Journal, said Tuesday that it was considering the sale of the rest of the Ottaway community newspaper group.
